cd:Record.name: Level_2B_Proc_Params_03_95
cd:Record.cd:Description: Level 2B Processing Parameters GADS DSR
Fields responsible for populating the Fixed Header

cd:Text.cd:Description: 1-line description of the file
Aeolus

cd:Integer.cd:Description: 4 digits used to distinguish between versions of a file having the same validity period

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Wind Velocity Measurement

cd:Text.cd:Description: File type string
ASCII string describing the product

cd:Float.cd:Description: Tolerance above which Mie and Rayleigh rangebins are considered mismatched

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating whether the horizontal or line-of-sight wind component should be reported

If set to True the edge values reported for a wind result will be taken from the center datetime value of the first and last included measurement as reported in the L1B product. If set to False the first measurement will be shifted backward and the last measurement will be shifted forward by half the measurement time to ensure the reported timespan matches with the actual measurement time. This prevents reporting identical start and stop datetime values in case a wind is based on a single measurement.

If set to True the edge values reported for a wind result will be taken from the center location value of the first and last included measurement as reported in the L1B product. If set to False the first measurement will be shifted backward and the last measurement will be shifted forward by half the measurement length to ensure the reported integration length matches with the actual measurement integration length. This prevents reporting identical start and stop values in case a wind is based on a single measurement.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters controlling the Mie grouping scheme applied by the L2B processing.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Method to be used for composing groups of measurements, determining the maximum possible observation size after classification and accumulation.

cd:Float.cd:Description: maximum allowed vertical difference between 2 rangebins with the same index. If a rangebin is found that has a larger difference a new group will be started
maximum horizontal difference between first and last measurement in a group. If a measurement at larger distance is found a new group will be started
maximum length of missing measurements before a group definition is closed and a new group is started

cd:Integer.cd:Description: define how many BRCs will be combined together is a group, in case the grouping method is set to combine BRCs

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters controlling the Rayleigh grouping scheme applied by the L2B processing.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Method to be used for composing groups of measurements, determining the maximum possible observation size after classification and accumulation.

cd:Float.cd:Description: maximum allowed vertical difference between 2 rangebins with the same index. If a rangebin is found that has a larger difference a new group will be started
maximum horizontal difference between first and last measurement in a group. If a measurement at larger distance is found a new group will be started
maximum length of missing measurements before a group definition is closed and a new group is started

cd:Integer.cd:Description: define how many BRCs will be combined together is a group, in case the grouping method is set to combine BRCs

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters controlling the subgrouping scheme applied by the L2B processing.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Method to be used for composing subgroups of measurements, intended to increase the SNR of the signal before entering the optical properties and classification algorithm.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Defines how many measurements will be combined together as a subgroup, in case the subgroup method is set to “n_meas”.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for the Classification algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: The classification type for the Mie channel
The classification type for the Rayleigh channel
A fallback option for the classification type for the Rayleigh channel, to be used in case the primary method yields no result.

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of BackscatterRatio_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of BackscatterRatio_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of Extinction_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of Extinction_threshold structures
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of SNR_threshold structures to be used for classification of a Mie rangebin using a threshold on the SNR value.
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of SNR_threshold structures to be used for classification of a Rayleigh rangebin using a threshold on the corresponding Mie SNR value.
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Thresholds to be used for classification of a rangebin
Altitude at which Threshold_Value is valid

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for the algorithms determining the optical properties of the atmosphere

cd:Text.cd:Description: The method to be used to get the scattering ratio
A backup method to get the scattering ratio, to be used when ScatRatio_Method gives no result, i.e. returns a missing_data indicator
The method to be used to get the signal to noise ratio.
A backup method to get the signal to noise ratio, to be used when SNR_Method gives no result, i.e. returns a missing_data indicator.
the method to be used to get the particle extinction.
the method to be used to get the molecular extinction.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum Altitude at which scattering ratio (Rho) may be set to 1
Minimum Altitude at which signal to noise ratio (SNR) may be set to 0
Filter exponent used to damp oscillatory behaviour when retrieving bin extinction
Optional predefined cross-talk factor (not used when set to -1.0)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Window width in horizontal (x) direction used by median filter
Window width in vertical (y) direction used by median filter
If True: take Rayleigh Channel calibration values from the Aux. Cal. input file; if False: derive these values from the upper range bin
If True: derive cross-talk factor from the Aux.Cal input file; if False: t.b.d.
Apply the median filter to smooth out noise after applying the 2D feature finder
apply the 2D feature finder algorithm to find cloud and/or aerosol layers in each group of measurements

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold used to decide of the Rayleigh channel calibration factor as derived from the upper range bin is to be trusted or not
L1B Scattering ratio values below this value are rounded down to 1. This is useful to suppress the unevitable noise

cd:Integer.cd:Description: if True: use the SR bias correction to correct the SR values produced by the L1B algorithm

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of BiasCorrection structures to be used for correcting the scattering ratio values
used for classification of a rangebin using a threshold on the extinction value

cd:Float.cd:Description: value defining one of the x values for the curve defining the bias correction
Bias correction value (y value) associated to the above point (x value)

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for the algorithms determining the Error properties of the reported wind results

cd:Text.cd:Description: The method to be used to calculate the Error quantifier for the Mie channel
The method to be used to calculate the Error quantifier for the Rayleigh channel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Common Processing Parameters
Processing parameters for Mie product confidence params SNR and backscatter-ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SNR

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Summation index for calculation of SNR and backscatter ratio

cd:Float.cd:Description: Cubic correction factor for the calculation of the Mie Scattering Ratio
Cubic correction factor for the calculation of the Mie Scattering Ratio
Cubic correction factor for the calculation of the Mie Scattering Ratio
Cubic correction factor for the calculation of the Mie Scattering Ratio

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Core Algorithm as applied for measurement data

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off
Starting value for FWHM
Threshold on the change in residual error while doing the Mie Core iterative fitting. If the change from one iteration to the next drops below this threshold the iteration is stopped.

Maximum threshold for the final Mie Core fitting residual, i.e. the quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel. If the threshold is not met then the fit result is flagged as invalid.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in Lorentz fit-loop

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Relative (upper) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Relative (lower) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Peak location threshold
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of interations of Downhill Simplex algorithm
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Processing parameters for Mie Core Algorithm as applied for internal reference pulses

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to switch Mie-Core processing on/off
Starting value for FWHM
Threshold on the change in residual error while doing the Mie Core iterative fitting. If the change from one iteration to the next drops below this threshold the iteration is stopped.

Maximum threshold for the final Mie Core fitting residual, i.e. the quadratic sum of differences between modeled and measured ACCD counts per pixel. If the threshold is not met then the fit result is flagged as invalid.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in Lorentz fit-loop

cd:Float.cd:Description: Upper threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Lower threshold for FWHM of Lorentz function for quality check
Relative (upper) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Relative (lower) threshold for peak height of Lorentz function
Peak location threshold
Stop threshold for Downhill Simplex algorithm merit function

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of interations of Downhill Simplex algorithm
Number of functional evaluations of Lorentz fit function for one pixel

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters for corrupt data detection

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum signal derivative. Maximum valid pixel intensity difference between adjacent CCD pixels
Pixel saturation threshold

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the Mie algorithm.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether L1B Mie Core Algorithm Parameters should be copied/used in the L2BP
In case Mie Core Algorithm Parameters are taken from the L1B product, copy the parameters used for measurement fitting to the parameters used for internal reference fitting
Switch to select whether L1B Mie Scattering Ratio Parameters should be copied/used in the L2BP.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Switch to select Mie height assignment method.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Weight given to upper altitude of range bin (applicable when Mie Height Assignment Method = use fixed weight).

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether Mie Nonlinearity Correction should be skipped in the L2BP or not
Switch to select whether Mie Nonlinearity Correction (calibration data) should be extrapolated in the L2BP or not

cd:Float.cd:Description: Weight given to ACCD column 20 in (Mie) offset subtraction

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to choose if dark current offset correction is performed in the L2BP Mie Core algorithm or not (needed in case it was switched off in the L1bP as well and implicitly handled by the DCMZ1B calibration file instead).

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of SNR threshold structures to be used for quality control of L2B Mie hlos retrievals.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold to be used for quality control of L2B Mie hlos retrievals
Lowest altitude at which Threshold Value is valid
Highest altitude at which Threshold Value is valid

cd:Text.cd:Description: Description of reference level for altitude.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: A switch to force all clear Mie winds to be flagged invalid

cd:Record.cd:Description: A list indicating which Mie channel range bins cannot be trusted, for example due to the "hot-pixel" problem. The list size must be between 0 and 24. (3 range bins are assumed for the size calculation)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: rangebin index defining that this rangebin cannot be trusted

cd:Float.cd:Description: multiplication factor applied to spacecraft LOS velocity correction to the HLOS wind result. Set to 0.0 to disable this correction. Set to 1.0 to enable it. Intermediate values are possible as well
optional hlos bias correction for experimental use only (for expert use only, not intended for users not familiar with the details of the Aeolus Calibration files).

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If set to true, switch on the M1 telescope temperature wind bias correction as defined by the AUX_TEL input file.
Switch that can be used to enforce filling the Internal Reference Mie Peak Position with a constant value

cd:Float.cd:Description: Fixed value to be used for the Internal Reference Mie Peak Position, in case we enforce it to be filled with a constant value

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch that can be used to enable use of the fitted non-linear correction as is provided in the incoming L1B product file

Switch that can be used to enable overriding the fitted Mie-NL correction data for the internal path as is provided in the incoming L1B product file. Note that it will only be used if also the Use_Fitted_Nonlinear_Correction switch is set to True

cd:Record.cd:Description: A list of ACCD pixel corrections against ACCS pixel index location that can be used to enable overriding the fitted Mie-NL correction data for the internal path as is provided in the incoming L1B product file.
Fitted Int Ref Mie NL Correction

cd:Float.cd:Description: Pixel position for which this Mie non-linearity correction will be applied
Mie non-linearity correction to be applied

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch that can be used to enable overriding the fitted Mie-NL correction data for the atmospheric path as is provided in the incoming L1B product file. Note that it will only be used if also the Use_Fitted_Nonlinear_Correction switch is set to True

cd:Record.cd:Description: A list of ACCD pixel corrections against ACCS pixel index location that can be used to enable overriding the fitted Mie-NL correction data for the atmospheric path as is provided in the incoming L1B product file.
Fitted_Atm_Path_Mie_NL_Correction

cd:Float.cd:Description: Pixel position for which this Mie non-linearity correction will be applied
Mie non-linearity correction to be applied
Maximum value reported for the Mie HLOS error. If the algorithm produces a larger value, it will be trunctaed at this value before reporting it in the L2B product.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Collected settings for the Mie channel spike detection algorithm.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Enable the algorithm to detect and remove measurements with suspicious signal spikes.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold (in percentage of the maximum detected signal) to be used for detecting suspicious secundary peaks in the spectrum

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Only remove measurements with suspicious spikes if this improves the accumulated SNR of the Mie spectrum.
Display internal details of the spike detection algorithm during processing. Only useful when debugging or further developing this algorithm.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the RBC algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: Switch to select Rayleigh height assignment method.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Weight given to upper altitude of range bin (applicable when Rayleigh Height Assignment Method = use fixed weight)

cd:Text.cd:Description: A switch to define how to do decontamination of the Rayleigh Clear winds.
A switch to define a backup method controlling how to do decontamination of the Rayleigh Clear winds. Only used if the primary method yields a missing result.
A switch to define how to do decontamination of the Rayleigh Cloudy winds.
A switch to define a backup method controlling how to do decontamination of the Rayleigh Cloudy winds. Only used if the primary method yields a missing result.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to force the scattering ratio as used for decontamination of the Rayleigh signal to one. This should not affect the reported Scattering_Ratio in the L2B_Rayleigh_Wind_PCD_ADS data set. But it will force the Reference_Backscatter_Ratio value as reported in the L2B/L2C Rayleigh Wind MDS to one.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Safety threshold to check the scattering ratio value (rho) used as input for averaging in case DSR_Method_Average is used. A value of -1 can be used to disable this check.
Safety threshold to check the scattering ratio value (rho) used as input for averaging in case DSR_Method_Average is used. A value of -1 can be used to disable this check.
Safety threshold to check the scattering ratio value (rho) calculated internally, and used for Mie decontamination of the Rayleigh wind. A value of -1 can be used to disable this check.
Safety threshold to check the scattering ratio value (rho) calculated internally, and used for Mie decontamination of the Rayleigh wind. A value of -1 can be used to disable this check.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: A switch to force all cloudy Rayleigh winds to be flagged invalid

cd:Record.cd:Description: A list indicating which Rayleigh channel range bins cannot be trusted, for example due to the "hot-pixel" problem. The list size must be between 0 and 24. (3 range bins are assumed for the size calculation)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: rangebin index defining that this rangebin cannot be trusted

cd:Float.cd:Description: multiplication factor applied to spacecraft LOS velocity correction to the HLOS wind result. Set to 0.0 to disable this correction. Set to 1.0 to enable it. Intermediate values are possible as well
optional hlos bias correction for experimental use only (for expert use only, not intended for users not familiar with the details of the Aeolus Calibration files).

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If set to true, switch on the M1 telescope temperature wind bias correction as defined by the AUX_TEL input file.

cd:Text.cd:Description: A switch to controls how the reference Rayleigh Response is defined.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Fixed value to be used for the Internal Reference Rayleigh Response, in case we enforce it to be filled with a constant value
Parameter that defines the offset when converting the Mie mean frequency to the reference Rayleigh Response.
Parameter that defines the slope when converting the Mie mean frequency to the reference Rayleigh Response.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters needed to calculate the Rayleigh Response correction for cloudy winds using the NWP based parameterization

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch that controls wether the response correction is applied or not.

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of alpha values as used by the parameterization for the response correction

cd:Float.cd:Description: Alpha

cd:Record.cd:Description: List of beta values as used by the parameterization for the response correction

cd:Float.cd:Description: Beta
Minimum Rayleigh response value allowed for the measurement signal for producing a valid wind.
Maximum Rayleigh response value allowed for the measurement signal for producing a valid wind.
Minimum Rayleigh response value allowed for the internal reference signal for producing a valid wind.
Maximum Rayleigh response value allowed for the internal reference signal for producing a valid wind.
Minimum atmospheric signal LOS speed component
Maximum atmospheric signal LOS speed component
Minimum reference signal LOS speed component
Maximum reference signal LOS speed component
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to rayleigh Response
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to rayleigh Response
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric temperature
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric temperature
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric pressure
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric pressure
Minimum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric scattering ratio
Maximum gradient of LOS speed component with respect to atmospheric scattering ratio

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the L1B-AMD matchup algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: Matchup method to be used for L1B-AMD matchup. 0: one-for-one between L1B BRC and AMD DSR, 1: Nearest-neighbour in space and time

cd:Float.cd:Description: Maximum allowed time difference in seconds between L1B BRC and AMD DSR
Maximum allowed distance in kilometres between L1B BRC and AMD DSR
Maximum Analysis time difference in seconds

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the AUX_MET data interpolation algorithm.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Explanation.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Settings used for inperpolation and extrapolation of the pressure profile against altitude in the external AUX_MET data.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Type of interpolation used.
Type of extrapolation used above the highest provided altitude.
Type of extrapolation used below the lowest provided altitude.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Settings used for inperpolation and extrapolation of the temperature profile against altitude in the external AUX_MET data.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Type of interpolation used.
Type of extrapolation used above the highest provided altitude.
Type of extrapolation used below the lowest provided altitude.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Settings used for inperpolation and extrapolation of the profile of U wind component against altitude in the external AUX_MET data.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Type of interpolation used.
Type of extrapolation used above the highest provided altitude.
Type of extrapolation used below the lowest provided altitude.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Settings used for inperpolation and extrapolation of the profile of V wind component against altitude in the external AUX_MET data.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Type of interpolation used.
Type of extrapolation used above the highest provided altitude.
Type of extrapolation used below the lowest provided altitude.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used by the L1B-CLM matchup algorithm

cd:Text.cd:Description: Matchup method to be used for L1B-CLM matchup. 0: TBD, 1: Nearest-neighbour in space and time

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used to specify the L2B Zero-Wind Correction

cd:Text.cd:Description: Zero-Wind Correction scheme to be used for L2B Mie processing.
Zero-Wind Correction scheme to be used for L2B Rayleigh processing.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mie ground correction weighting factor
Mie HBE ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Rayleigh HBE ground correction weighting factor
Mie-Rayleigh ground correction weighting factor
Mie-Rayleigh HBE ground correction weighting factor
Mie-Rayleigh ground correction weighting offset

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters to control the Range Dependent Bias (RDB) correction

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to select whether Mie Range Dependent Bias correction should be done in the L2BP
Switch to select whether Rayleigh Range Dependent Bias correction should be done in the L2BP

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters to control the additional ground flagging of winds on L2B side for both channels.
Structure holding threshold settings used for additional ground flagging of winds on top of the L1B defined ground detection results.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Extra margin above DEM as reported by the L1B processor for which winds will be flagged invalid. A negative value will disable this DEM check. A special value of -128 can be used to trigger a compatibility mode for which the maximum DEM height in the group will be used for this check, and not the local measurement level DEM value. The actual margin value will be set back to 0 if you use this. This will mimic the implementation that was present in L2BP v3.50 and before, and is mainly intended to be used to test the difference between the old and the new implementation.
Extra margin above detected ground as reported by the L1B processor for which winds will be flagged invalid. A negative value will disable this ground check.
Extra margin above DEM as reported by the AUX_MET file for which winds will be flagged invalid. A negative value will disable this AUX_MET DEM check.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Structure holding threshold settings used for additional ground flagging of winds on top of the L1B defined ground detection results.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Extra margin above DEM as reported by the L1B processor for which winds will be flagged invalid
Extra margin above detected ground as reported by the L1B processor for which winds will be flagged invalid
Extra margin above DEM as reported by the AUX_MET file for which winds will be flagged invalid

cd:Record.cd:Description: Collected Screening Parameters used for testing the input files and the generated results
Parameters used for screening the L1B input file
Parameters used for screening the L1B observations from the L1B input file
Parameters used for screening the L1B Mie Measurements from the L1B input file
Parameters used for screening the L1B Rayleigh Measurements from the L1B input file
Shared parameters for both channels used for screening the L1B Rayleigh Measurements from the L1B input file.
Parameters used for screening the L2B_AMD input file

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum pressure allowed in a pressure profile
Maximum pressure allowed in a pressure profile
Minimum temperature allowed in a temperature profile
Maximum temperature allowed in a temperature profile

cd:Record.cd:Description: Parameters used for screening the AUX RBC input file

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum frequency allowed in the Fcalib array of the AUX_RBC input file.
Maximum frequency allowed in the Fcalib array of the AUX_RBC input file.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Defines a vertical threshold curve for screening the generated HLOS winds.
Collected Monitoring Parameters used for testing the generated wind results

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold applied to the estimated Mie wind error to select wind results that will be taken in to account in the O-B statistics. (set it to zero to disable this selection)
Threshold applied to the estimated Rayleigh wind error to select wind results that will be taken in to account in the O-B statistics. (set it to zero to disable this selection)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch controlling wether O-minus-B statistical results will be used for quality control or not. If set to true, the following "Min_Bias_to_Flag_a_Hot_Pixel" parameter is used to decide how to flag the wind results.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold used on bias to decide if the current range bin is affected by an uncorrected hot-pixel or not. If the above "Use_OminB_to_Flag_Hot_Pixels" switch is set to true, and if the average bias for the current file is above this threshold, the produced winds are flagged invalid.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Threshold used to decide if we have enough statistics to be able to flag wind results based on O-minus-B bias. If the number of winds is too small, the statistics are not significant enough, and wind results will not be flagged, even if the bias is passed. Use a value of 0 to switch off this setting.

Switch controlling wether O-minus-B statistical results will be used for quality control for the moon blinding check or not. If set to true, the following “Min_Bias_to_Flag_Moon_Blinding” parameter is used to decide how to flag the wind results in case moon blinding occurs.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Threshold used on bias to decide together with the occurrence of moon blinding if the current range bin is affected by a moon blinding bias problem or not. If the above “Use_OminB_to_Flag_Moon_Blinding” switch is set to true, and if the average bias for the current file is above this threshold, and if moon blinding is flagged by the L1B product, then the produced winds are flagged invalid.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Threshold used to decide if we have enough statistics to be able to flag wind results based on O-minus-B bias in case of moon blinding. If the number of winds is too small, the statistics are not significant enough, and wind results will not be flagged, even if the bias is passed. Use a value of 0 to switch off this setting.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Blacklisting Parameters used to flag winds invalid in case of know problems.

List of zero or more periods for which wind results should be blacklisted to indicate to users that the winds are not to be trusted and should most probably not be used in data assimilation or for scientific studies.

cd:Time.cd:Description: Start datetime of period to be blacklisted.
Stop datetime of period to be blacklisted.

cd:Text.cd:Description: Name of channel for which this blacklisting period should be applied. Allowed values are "Mie", "Rayleigh" or "Both"
